20110130030130.000|20110130030132.000|TR0|LEMON:  Tens of thousands of Egyptians on 
20110130030132.000|20110130030135.000|TR0|Saturday ended a fifth day of protesting 
20110130030135.000|20110130030137.000|TR0|defiance, ignoring a curfew imposed by the 
20110130030137.000|20110130030139.000|TR0|government.  Dozens of people have died in 
20110130030139.000|20110130030142.000|TR0|violent clashes with riot police over the 
20110130030142.000|20110130030144.000|TR0|past week.  Countless others were hurt.  
20110130030144.000|20110130030147.000|TR0|But then suddenly the riot police 
20110130030147.000|20110130030149.000|TR0|disappeared replaced by military troops 
20110130030149.000|20110130030151.000|TR0|and tanks and armored vehicles.  So far 
20110130030151.000|20110130030154.000|TR0|the military and civilians have avoided 
20110130030154.000|20110130030156.000|TR0|clashing with each other but now the 
20110130030156.000|20110130030158.000|TR0|anti-Mubarak groundswell has spread to 
20110130030158.000|20110130030201.000|TR0|cities around the world.
